politicsGeneralProvisionsText: This privacy policy has been prepared in accordance with the requirements of Federal Law of 27.07.2006. â„– 152-FZ "On Personal Data" (hereinafter - the Personal Data Law) and defines the procedure for processing personal data and measures to ensure the security of personal data taken by Organization Name (hereinafter - the Operator).
politics.1.1: The Operator sets as its most important goal and condition for carrying out its activities the observance of the rights and freedoms of man and citizen when processing his personal data, including the protection of the rights to privacy, personal and family secrets.
politics.1.2: This Operator's Policy regarding the processing of personal data (hereinafter - the Policy) applies to all information that the Operator may obtain about visitors to the website https://opt-turkie.com.
politics.2: Basic concepts used in the Policy
politics.2.1: Automated processing of personal data - processing of personal data using computer technology.
politics.2.2: Blocking of personal data - temporary suspension of the processing of personal data (except cases if processing is necessary for clarification of personal data).
politics.2.3: Website - a set of graphic and information materials, as well as computer programs and databases, ensuring their availability in the Internet at the network address https://opt-turkie.com.
politics.2.4: Information system of personal data - a set of personal data contained in databases and ensuring their processing of information technologies and technical means.
politics.2.5: De-personalization of personal data - actions as a result of which it is impossible to determine without the use of additional information the belonging of personal data to a specific User or other subject of personal data.
politics.2.6: Processing of personal data - any action (operation) or a set of actions (operations) performed using automation tools or without using such tools with personal data, including collection, recording, systematization, accumulation, storage, clarification (updating, changing), extraction, use, transfer (distribution, provision, access), depersonalization, blocking, deletion, destruction of personal data.
politics.2.7: Operator - a state body, a municipal body, a legal or natural person, independently or jointly with other persons organizing and/or carrying out processing of personal data, as well as determining the purposes of processing personal data, the composition of personal data subject to processing, actions (operations) performed with personal data.
politics.2.8: Personal data - any information directly or indirectly related to a specific or determined User of the website https://opt-turkie.com.
politics.2.9: Personal data permitted for distribution by the subject of personal data - personal data to which unlimited access is provided by the subject of personal data by giving consent to the processing of personal data permitted by the subject of personal data for distribution in the manner provided by the Personal Data Law (hereinafter - personal data permitted for distribution).
politics.2.10: User - any visitor to the website https://opt-turkie.com.
politics.2.11: Provision of personal data - actions aimed at disclosing personal data to a specific person or specific circle of persons.
politics.2.12: Distribution of personal data - any actions aimed at disclosing personal data to an indefinite circle of persons (transfer of personal data) or familiarizing them with personal data by an unlimited number of persons, including disclosure of personal data in mass media, posting on information and telecommunication networks or providing access to personal data in any other way.
politics.2.13: Cross-border transfer of personal data - transfer of personal data to the territory of a foreign state to the authority of a foreign state, foreign individual or foreign legal entity.
politics.2.14: Destruction of personal data - any actions as a result of which personal data are destroyed irreversibly with the impossibility of further restoration of the content of personal data in the information system of personal data and/or personal data carriers are destroyed.
politics.3.line.1: to obtain from the data subject accurate information and/or documents containing personal data;
politics.3.line.2: in case of withdrawal by the data subject of consent to the processing of personal data, as well as the submission of a request to cease processing of personal data, the Operator has the right to continue processing personal data without the consent of the data subject if there are grounds specified in the Personal Data Law;
politics.3.line.3: to independently determine the composition and list of measures necessary and sufficient to ensure the performance of obligations provided for by the Personal Data Law and adopted in accordance with it regulatory legal acts, unless otherwise provided by the Personal Data Law or other federal laws.
politics.3.2.line.1: to provide the data subject upon his request with information related to the processing of his personal data;
politics.3.2.line.2: to organize the processing of personal data in the manner established by the current legislation of the Russian Federation;
politics.3.2.line.3: to respond to requests and inquiries from data subjects and their legal representatives in accordance with the requirements of the Personal Data Law;
politics.3.2.line.4: to provide the necessary information to the authorized body for the protection of the rights of data subjects upon request of this body within 10 days from the date of receipt of such request;
politics.3.2.line.5: to publish or otherwise ensure unlimited access to this Policy regarding the processing of personal data;
politics.3.2.line.6: to take legal, organizational, and technical measures to protect personal data from unauthorized or accidental access to them, destruction, modification, blocking, copying, provision, distribution of personal data, as well as from other unlawful actions with personal data;
politics.3.2.line.7: to cease the transfer (distribution, provision, access) of personal data, cease processing and destroy personal data in the cases and in the manner provided for by the Personal Data Law;
politics.3.2.line.8: to perform other duties provided for by the Personal Data Law.
politics.4: Basic Rights and Obligations of Personal Data Subjects
politics.4.1.line.1: to obtain information related to the processing of their personal data, except in cases provided for by federal laws. Information is provided to the data subject by the Operator in an accessible form, and it should not contain personal data related to other data subjects, except in cases where there are legal grounds for disclosing such personal data. The list of information and the procedure for its receipt are established by the Personal Data Law;
politics.4.1.line.2: to demand from the operator clarification of his personal data, their blocking or destruction in case the personal data are incomplete, outdated, inaccurate, illegally obtained, or not necessary for the stated purpose of processing, as well as to take measures provided by law to protect their rights;
politics.4.1.line.3: to require prior consent when processing personal data for the purpose of promoting goods, works, or services on the market;
politics.4.1.line.4: to withdraw consent to the processing of personal data, as well as to submit a request to cease processing of personal data;
politics.4.1.line.5: to appeal to the authorized body for the protection of the rights of data subjects or in court against unlawful actions or inaction of the Operator in processing his personal data;
politics.4.1.line.6: to exercise other rights provided for by the legislation of the Russian Federation.
politics.4.2.line.1: to provide the Operator with accurate data about themselves;
politics.4.2.line.2: to inform the Operator about the clarification (updating, changing) of their personal data.
politics.4.3: Persons who provided the Operator with false information about themselves or information about another data subject without the latter's consent shall be liable in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation.
politics.5.1: Processing of personal data is carried out on a legal and fair basis.
politics.5.2: Processing of personal data is limited to the achievement of specific, predetermined, and legitimate purposes. Processing of personal data incompatible with the purposes of collecting personal data is not allowed.
politics.5.3: Combining databases containing personal data processed for incompatible purposes is not allowed.
politics.5.4: Only personal data that meets the purposes of their processing should be processed.
politics.5.5: The content and scope of processed personal data should correspond to the stated purposes of processing. Processing of personal data in excess of the stated purposes of their processing is not allowed.
politics.5.6: When processing personal data, their accuracy, sufficiency, and, where necessary, relevance to the purposes of processing of personal data shall be ensured. The operator shall take necessary measures and/or ensure their taking to delete or clarify incomplete or inaccurate data.
politics.5.7: Storage of personal data shall be carried out in a form that allows identifying the personal data subject, no longer than required for the purposes of processing personal data, unless the storage period of personal data is established by federal law, contract, the party to which, the beneficiary or the guarantor of which is the personal data subject. Processed personal data shall be destroyed or anonymized upon achievement of the purposes of processing or in case of loss of the need to achieve these purposes, unless otherwise provided by federal law.
politics.6.dot.1: Informing the User by sending emails
politics.6.dot.3: Federal Law of the Russian Federation "On Information, Information Technologies and Information Protection"
politics.7.1: Processing of personal data is carried out with the consent of the personal data subject to the processing of his personal data.
politics.7.2: Processing of personal data is necessary for the implementation of the purposes provided for by an international treaty of the Russian Federation or by law, for the performance of duties, powers, and responsibilities imposed by law on the operator of the Russian Federation.
politics.7.3: Processing of personal data is necessary for the administration of justice, enforcement of a judicial act, act of another body or official, which must be enforced in accordance with the legislation of the Russian Federation on enforcement proceedings.
politics.7.4: Processing of personal data is necessary for the performance of a contract, the party to which, the beneficiary or the guarantor of which is the personal data subject, as well as for the conclusion of a contract initiated by the personal data subject or a contract under which the personal data subject will be a beneficiary or a guarantor.
politics.7.5: Processing of personal data is necessary for the realization of the rights and legitimate interests of the operator or third parties or for the achievement of socially significant goals, provided that the rights and freedoms of the personal data subject are not violated.
politics.7.6: Processing of personal data, access to which is provided to an unlimited number of persons by the personal data subject or at his request (hereinafter referred to as publicly available personal data).
politics.7.7: Processing of personal data subject to publication or mandatory disclosure in accordance with federal law.
politics.8: Procedure for Collection, Storage, Transmission, and Other Processing of Personal Data
politics.8.text: The security of personal data processed by the Operator is ensured by implementing legal, organizational, and technical measures necessary to fully comply with the requirements of current legislation in the field of personal data protection.
politics.8.1: The Operator ensures the security of personal data and takes all possible measures to prevent unauthorized access to personal data.
politics.8.2: The User's personal data will never, under any circumstances, be transferred to third parties, except in cases related to the execution of current legislation or if the data subject has consented to the transfer of data to a third party to fulfill civil law contract obligations.
politics.8.3: If inaccuracies in personal data are identified, the User can update them independently by sending a notification to the Operator via email to the Operator's email address privacy@thismywebsite.com with the subject 'Updating Personal Data.'
politics.8.4: The processing period for personal data is determined by the achievement of the purposes for which the personal data were collected, unless a different period is provided by contract or current legislation.
politics.8.4.text: The User may at any time revoke their consent to the processing of personal data by sending a notification to the Operator via email to the Operator's email address privacy@thismywebsite.com with the subject 'Revoking Consent to Process Personal Data.'
politics.8.5: All information collected by third-party services, including payment systems, communication tools, and other service providers, is stored and processed by those third parties (Operators) in accordance with their User Agreement and Privacy Policy. The data subject and/or with those documents. The Operator is not responsible for the actions of third parties, including the service providers mentioned in this section.
politics.8.6: Prohibitions on the transfer (except for providing access), processing, or processing conditions (except for obtaining access) of personal data set by the data subject do not apply when processing personal data in the public, social, and other public interests defined by Russian legislation.
politics.8.7: The Operator ensures the confidentiality of personal data during processing.
politics.8.8: The Operator stores personal data in a form that allows the identification of the data subject for no longer than necessary for the purposes of processing personal data, unless the storage period of personal data is established by federal law, contract, or by the party to the contract, beneficiary, or guarantor on whose behalf the data subject is.
politics.8.9: The termination conditions for the processing of personal data may include the achievement of the purposes of processing personal data, expiration of the data subject's consent, withdrawal of consent by the data subject, or a request to stop processing personal data, as well as the detection of unlawful processing of personal data.
politics.9: List of Actions Performed by the Operator with Obtained Personal Data
politics.9.1: The Operator performs the collection, recording, systematization, accumulation, storage, clarification (updating, changing), extraction, use, transmission (distribution, provision, access), anonymization, blocking, deletion, and destruction of personal data.
politics.9.2: The Operator carries out automated processing of personal data with the receipt and/or transmission of received information via information and telecommunication networks or without such transmission.
politics.10.1: Before commencing activities for the cross-border transfer of personal data, the Operator must notify the authorized body for the protection of the rights of personal data subjects of the Russian Federation of its intention to carry out cross-border transfer of personal data (such notification is sent separately from the notification of intention to process personal data).
politics.10.2: Before submitting the above notification, the Operator must obtain relevant information from foreign government agencies, foreign individuals, and foreign legal entities from which the cross-border transfer of personal data is planned.
politics.11.text: The Operator and other persons who have access to personal data are obliged not to disclose or disseminate personal data to third parties without the consent of the data subject, unless otherwise provided by federal law.
politics.12.1: The User may obtain any clarifications on matters of interest regarding the processing of their personal data by contacting the Operator via email at privacy@thismywebsite.com.
politics.12.2: Any changes to the Operator's personal data processing policy will be reflected in this document. The policy remains in effect indefinitely until replaced by a new version.
politics.12.3: The current version of the Policy is freely available on the Internet at https://opt-turkie.com/ptivacy.
